I'm trying to convince a group of fellow employees that they should develop
an internal webapp RESTfully instead of using SOAP/XML-RPC and friends. The
client in this context isn't a web browser but instead a java application.
One argument in favor of SOAP is that the java toolkits, client and server,
are pretty good, while with RESTful HTTP, the server toolkits are pretty
good while clients aren't so much.

Do y'all buy this argument? Can anyone recommend a very good HTTP client
for RESTful application development in java?

- donald
